value.title: Demystifying Custom Partitions in Power BI
value.excerpt: We talk about Incremental Refresh a lot, but what if you need custom partitions in Power BI? How do you even create those? They look scary! Patrick takes the mystery away and walks you through how you can create them.  Partitions in tabular models https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/partitions-ssas-tabular
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6CRqdsLjHNA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration
value.excerpt: In this 2 minute Tuesday, Patrick looks at how to use Excel and OneDrive with Power BI For Collaboration. Using this approach, you can easily keep Power BI updated when team members update an Excel spreadsheet hosted on OneDrive. This is a great alternative to using Google Sheets which can be painful
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t4TzHu8THoA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)
value.excerpt: I show how you can take a table that lists "Record" and expand that within Power BI. This also works with Power Query. I have a look at the M Syntax and show a cleaner approach.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/sbPS3ZKIt7g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)

value.title: Exploring the Visio visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Want to explore locations with data? The Visio visual in Power BI helps you do just that! Patrick looks at how to set it up and help use your data to highlight areas within a Visio diagram.  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/visiosample  Documentation: https://support.microsoft.com/office/add-visio-visuals-to-power-bi-reports-4f09be62-f436-45c2-93b0-4a0f66b1f5a7
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZkL2jo3b_5M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How do you even use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI???
value.excerpt: Not sure how to use VertiPaq Analyzer with Power BI to optimize your data model? Marco Russo joins Patrick to show you how!  Connect with Marco: https://twitter.com/marcorus Download VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m34IOHcNPPo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How we optimize Power Query and Power BI Dataflows
value.excerpt: Let's go into Adam's mind as he optimizes Power Query to make some Power BI Dataflows run faster to avoid resource usage. The result is INSANE AMAZING!  Power Query M function reference https://docs.microsoft.com/powerquery-m/power-query-m-function-reference  ðŸ“¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium
value.excerpt: In this video, Christian Wade joined Adam Saxton to discuss Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium. You can use Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium to take your dataset beyond 1GB and avoid failures such as timeouts.  Incremental Refresh with Power BI Premium documentation - https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-premium-incremental-refresh
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/CajQjq70Kpg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we found out about Power BI Premium Gen2. It's now available for you to use and WOW! It has changed the game! Adam walks you through what the changes are to help you level up.  Docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-what-is#power-bi-premium-generation-2-preview
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/j17y_BPlhvU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Is Query Folding happening in Power BI?
value.excerpt: We look at how to tell if query folding is actually happening within Power BI. You may be surprised! Power Query has a few tools for you.  Sample download: https://guyinacu.be/queryfoldingsample  *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available

value.title: Making sense of the Power BI Premium Gen2 Metrics App
value.excerpt: Struggling ramping up on the Power BI Premium Gen2 Metrics App? Adam walks through the app to help you install it and navigate to get the most value. Some great stuff in the latest update!  Install the Gen2 metrics app https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/admin/service-premium-install-gen2-app
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/BmAuABIwhc0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Migrate your Paginated reports to Power BI
value.excerpt: Are your paginated reports still on-premises with either Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services? Want to move them to Power BI? Patrick shows you how you can do that using the RDLMigration tool!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/migrate-ssrs-reports-to-power-bi

value.title: Modern Data Lakehouse? Where do you even start??? Azure Synapse of course!
value.excerpt: Trying to get started with a Modern Data Lakehouse? There are so many options today. Where do you even begin? Patrick and Stijn help you get a handle on it with Azure Synapse Analytics!  Stijn Wynants https://twitter.com/SQLStijn  Building a Modern Lakehouse Data Warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics:

value.title: One Click Calculation Group in Power BI
value.excerpt: Calculation Groups in Power BI can be amazing! Patrick shows you how you can create these common patterns with just one click using Tabular Editor.  Blog: https://www.esbrina-ba.com/time-intelligence-the-smart-way/  Calculation Groups: https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/calculation-groups?view=asallproducts-allversions

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows a way you can use parameters and templates, with Power BI Desktop, to provide prompts for your connection's server and database properties.   This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JlUfz18cx_w" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the On-Premises Data Gateway. What is it exactly? This can be used with more than just Power BI. This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/WJ5Y4FjkWZw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Apps for Consumers
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. Power BI Apps are the main way that dashboards and reports are distributed widely in your organization.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton -- http://twitter.com/patrickdba

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Power BI query reduction when using DirectQuery
value.excerpt: Using DirectQuery in Power BI? Things slowing down and you want to make interactions snappier? Patrick looks how you can change a few settings to take the experience within Power BI to the next level!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Secure Embed - a no code / low code option
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the new Power BI Secure Embed. If you have been using Publish to Web internally, you need to look at this feature as it is the perfect replacement that adds a secure option for easy, frictionless, embedding.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8ASw-J0PuN8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals
